resp:

1. First, we need to identify which team played away from home.
2. In order to do so, we must find which row contains information about the "away team". This can be done by locating the cell containing "footscray", "geelong", "fitzroy", "essendon", "carlton", and "hawthorn".
3. For each of these cells, we need to check if their row index is greater than the row index of the first row (i.e., collingwood) in order to identify which team played away from home.
4. Once we know which team played away from home, we must then find which row contains a higher score for that team compared to all other teams that played at home.
5. In particular, if the "away team" is indeed fitzroy, then we need to verify that their score (18.11) is greater than the highest recorded score by any team playing at home (collingwood 7.14, melbourne 20.14 etc)
6. We can do this by comparing each row of the "home team" column in order to see which one has a higher value than fitzroy's away game score
7. If we find that there is only one row with a higher score for any home team, then we will confirm that claim is true; otherwise, it will be false

Here is our answer in the requested format:
